title: Yasuo does has a strong early, mid, and late game
body: but, like many squishy melees that deal sustained damage ({{champion:92}} {{champion:11}} ), he is feast or famine. Sure, if he's even on farm and kills with the enemy carries and finishes his core without falling behind, he's going to have a strong mid and late game. The moment he's 0/2 and 20 cs behind, he will get blown up before he even gets in range to deal damage. As a frontline squishy that's extremely vulnerable to hard cc, there's virtually no way to comeback if you get significantly behind with the exception of a lucky ult.

> Yasuo is a basically a paper tiger: he seems really strong, but once you understand how he works and learn to play around him he's actually pretty weak.

The problem isn't that. The problem is his windows are tiny. His ult has a short CD and his Q and E make him really hard to deal with no matter who you are unless you are {{champion:90}}. To top it off he has one of the best combinations of defensive abilities in the game (a decent personal shield and a shield that can protect him and his team from all projectiles and there are a lot of them). Sure the CD is decent, but as he ranks it up the windows go down. His kit needs bigger windows really. From his ult being on almost a 30s CD late game to his ability to infinite dash. I personally think he should spend  his flow for wind wall or it needs to actually spawn in a set place and not instant spawn and drift forward. And then maybe look at nerfing his MS to 335 and removing his wind wall giving vision.
